alert.note: Alert for Coastal Rockingham (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued August 30 at 3:51PM EDT until August 31 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 1 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding around the time of high tide tonight is likely. * WHERE...In Maine, Coastal York and Coastal Cumberland Counties. In New Hampshire, Coastal Rockingham County. * WHEN...For the High Rip Current Risk, through Thursday evening. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 10 PM this evening to 1 AM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Seavey Island / Portsmouth NH MLLW Categories - Minor 11.5 ft, Moderate 12.5 ft, Major 13.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 2.7 ft, Moderate 3.7 ft, Major 4.7 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 31/12 AM 11.0 2.2 1.0 2 None 31/12 PM 10.0 1.2 0.9 3 None 01/12 AM 10.9 2.1 0.8 2-3 None 01/01 PM 10.2 1.4 0.7 3 None 02/01 AM 10.3 1.5 0.3 3 None Hampton Harbor NH MLLW Categories - Minor 11.0 ft, Moderate 12.0 ft, Major 13.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.5 ft, Moderate 2.5 ft, Major 3.5 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 30/11 PM 10.8 1.3 0.5 2 None 31/12 PM 9.9 0.4 0.5 2-3 None 01/12 AM 11.2 1.7 0.8 2 Minor 01/01 PM 10.4 0.9 0.7 3 None 02/01 AM 10.6 1.1 0.3 3 None Portland ME MLLW Categories - Minor 12.0 ft, Moderate 13.0 ft, Major 14.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 2.3 ft, Moderate 3.3 ft, Major 4.3 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 30/11 PM 12.4 2.7 1.0 2-3 Minor 31/12 PM 11.1 1.4 0.8 3-4 None 01/12 AM 12.3 2.6 0.8 3 Minor 01/01 PM 11.5 1.8 0.8 3-4 None 02/01 AM 11.8 2.1 0.4 3 None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
